page.title: 16BESFORD VILLAGE
page.content: {Besford}is the only other settlement of any size in the block. It is a hamlet of approx.{16}houses and farms with a population of approx.{50. It is centred on the church of{St. {Peter, Home Farm and Church Farm. There is also a large Manor House to the north of the church surrounded by a curious serpentine wall. The village dates from before the{14th {century}although present housing stock is varied. On the road north out of the village is a block of five local authority houses. Many of the houses are surrounded by small holdings some specialising in deep litter hens. There is one road in and out of the village and the local children attend the nearby{Defford village school.
